work.name: Zenjob
work.summary: Zenjob, based in Berlin, Germany, matches over 20,000 talents with 12,000 part-time jobs from over 1,000 companies every month. The platform empowers the workforce of tomorrow, enabling part-time jobbers to decide when, where, and how to work with just a few clicks.
highlights: I played a pivotal role at Zenjob by leading the development of a customer-facing B2B platform for effi cientorder management. This involved extensive work on front-end development using React, Typescript andother technologies.

I actively participated in the development of the design system, contributing to a consistent and effi cientuser interface. Additionally, I was responsible for maintaining the mono-repository, ensuring smooth andcoordinated development efforts.

I made a significant impact by integrating end-to-end tests using Playwright, which greatly improved thereliability and stability of our front-end features. This automation effort was a key part of our front-enddevelopment process.

I was actively involved in monitoring system alerts to preemptively address potential incidents. Thisincluded resolving issues and conducting necessary post-mortems, using tools like Sentry, Grafana, andOpsGenie.

I consistently demonstrated an eagerness to learn and grow. I developed a habit of writing clear andtestable code, gained experience with Node.js and SSR frameworks such as Next.js, and cultivated a passionfor accessible web applications.

work.name: eLamp
work.summary: Involved in eLamp’s early stages as a student, we started from the founders’ couch. Despite challenges, we built a successful product, leading to eLamp’s acquisition by a larger group in 2023.
highlights: As the pioneering employee at eLamp, a startup, I had the unique opportunity to shape the company’s technological direction from its inception. Specializing in front-end development, I collaborated closely with the CTO to build a robust tech stack from scratch, mastering technologies such as TypeScript, React, and GraphQL.

Over five years, I developed complex user interfaces, including intricate graphs and other data visualization tools. An example of this is the development of a feature that significantly enhanced data interaction and understanding for our customers. In addition, I developed several features that made our product very user-friendly and enjoyable to use. I cultivated an appreciation for aesthetically pleasing designs and took great pleasure in crafting animations that were both functional and visually engaging.

I ensured the quality and reliability of our software through rigorous testing methodologies. This included unit testing, integration testing, and end-to-end testing using technologies like Cypress and React Testing Library. My commitment to quality assurance helped maintain high standards for our products and instilled confidence in our customers.
